adjectives.description: weaselly (comparative more weaselly or weasellier, superlative most weaselly or weaselliest)

examples: The writer had just entered into his eighteenth year, when he met at the table of a certain Anglo-Germanist an individual, apparently somewhat under thirty, of middle stature, a thin and weaselly figure, a sallow complexion, a certain obliquity of vision, and a large pair of spectacles.
With intellect weaselly, artist has easily earned all his bacon and greens by it,
And now that it’s done and all ready for Fun, it’s my duty to say what he means by it.
